title: "Trying to reconnect" Error [UNSOLVED]
body:
I'm experiencing this error for a few days now, I cant even get to champ select and it is very annoying at that point.

I'm in Israel and I have a local internet connection that is quite strong and I play many other games without anything weird or laggy.
The error happens both on the legacy and the beta client and it seems to restart randomly too.

Does anyone have any options because I'm all out and I tried most of the online fixes I found, including reinstalling the game multiple times.

EDIT: This bug happens more often during mornings than during evenings.

replies.body:
An update on the subject.
Today for some reason when I started a game with my friends I was able to start and enter the game, once in-game I was able to play fine with no disconnects but once the game ended I saw the launcher had a "Trying to reconnect" message which I assume was there before I finished the game. What I am trying to say is that it might just be the launcher/client that is bugged and not my connection to the servers...

I haven't heard of any sort of bugs that would cause this behavior. I'd like to take a look at your network routing to ensure there isn't an issue there. I recommend running a traceroute log with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) during a time you're experiencing the disconnection symptoms. After loading up the app, plug **31.186.224.42** into the host field and start the trace. After you've let it run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you ran into any issues.

According to this traceroute, your connection is unable to reach our test servers after dropping off at the following node:

> **internap-ic-305857-ffm-b11.c.telia.net**

I strongly recommend reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support team and provide them this entire traceroute so they can figure out what's going wrong after that telia node.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

Your estimate is probably correct. Once I used a VPN (CyberGhost 6 on an Italian server) It worked fine (Except for a few lag spikes but those can be blamed on the VPN). Any way to bypass that node without using a VPN?

The only way you'd potentially be able to bypass this node without a VPN would be to contact your ISP and see if they can make some routing changes from their end.

If you have any further questions, hit me up.

Disconnections that are paired with these errors are usually caused by one or more incompatible network settings that cause an unstable link to our servers. I recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in order to ensure your settings are fine.

Let me know if this caused any changes for you.

I have tried all of the fixes offered in the connection guide and none of them had any success at helping my current situation and any general web analyzer I have tried has returned an OK message. Are there any other options you can offer?
